cursorPrompts.title: Replicate Page Layout
cursorPrompts.content:
# Cursor Block ‚Äî Create ‚ÄúPortfolio Analysis‚Äù page (visual-only) **Goal:** Add a new page at `app/portfolio/page.tsx` that **copies the layout/structure** of the **Share Price** page but **removes page-specific interactivity**. Global app features (top nav, Test API button, Prompts Hub dropdown, layout shell) must remain fully functional. ## 1) Page spec (do, don‚Äôt) * **Route:** `/portfolio` (file: `app/portfolio/page.tsx`) * **Keep (global):** shared layout shell, top bar, **Test API** button, Prompts Hub dropdown (pulls options from Prompts Hub as usual). * **Keep (page visual only):** * Page title: **Portfolio Analysis** * Left column section title: **Portfolio Inputs** * Right column section title: **Analysis Results** * Navigation buttons (top-right of page body area): **Reset** and **Home** ‚Äî render as disabled (no handlers). * Placeholder chart area. * Event boxes section (static placeholders). * Two page-level dropdowns **rendered but inert** with the following static options (do **not** connect to state or APIs): * Dropdown A: `["Tech Stocks", "Blue Chips", "Growth"]` * Dropdown B: `["6 Months", "1 Year", "2 Years"]` * **Remove/avoid (page-level only):** onClick handlers, API calls, local state management, effects. Mark buttons/selects as `aria-disabled`/`disabled`. > Important: **Do not touch** shared components‚Äô internal logic (Prompts Hub dropdown, Test API). Only this page‚Äôs own controls should be inert. ## 2) Implement the page Create `app/portfolio/page.tsx` with the following: ```tsx // app/portfolio/page.tsx "use client"; import Link from "next/link"; // If you have shared layout wrappers or section components, import them here. // import { PageShell } from "@/components/layout/PageShell"; // import { SectionCard } from "@/components/ui/SectionCard"; export default function PortfolioAnalysisPage() { // No local state, no handlers. Purely presentational. return ( // If you have a shared shell, wrap in it instead of this
.
{/* Header row (inherits global top nav separately) */}

Portfolio Analysis

{/* Page-level navigation buttons (inert) */}
Home
{/* Two-column layout (clone of Share Price structure) */}
{/* Left: Inputs */}

Portfolio Inputs

{/* Inert dropdowns for this page only */} {/* Any other input placeholders go here, rendered inert */}
{/* Event boxes (visual-only) */}

Events

  • Earnings ‚Äî Placeholder
  • Dividends ‚Äî Placeholder
  • Guidance ‚Äî Placeholder
{/* Right: Results */}

Analysis Results

{/* Placeholder chart area */}
Chart Placeholder
{/* Optional notes/summary box, visual-only */}
Result summary placeholder. This page shows structure only; no interactive logic is wired.
); } ``` **Notes** * If your Share Price page uses shared components (cards, shells), swap my generic `
/
` wrappers with your shared components to match styles 1:1. * Buttons are intentionally `disabled`/`aria-disabled` with `cursor-not-allowed` styling. * The **Home** link is allowed to navigate‚Äîthis doesn‚Äôt count as page logic. ## 3) Add navigation tile on Home Add a new grid card linking to `/portfolio` on your home page (usually `app/page.tsx`). Follow your existing card pattern; here‚Äôs a safe generic version: ```tsx // In app/page.tsx ‚Äî inside the grid where other feature boxes live import Link from "next/link"; // ...
  • Page 25/75
    Portfolio Analysis

    Visual-only clone of Share Price layout (no page-level interactivity).

    • ``` If you have a reusable `Card` component, wrap the `` with that to ensure consistent spacing, radius, and hover. ## 4) Guardrails (so global features stay intact) * **Do not** alter shared layout, header, or providers. That preserves: * **Test API** button behavior * **Prompts Hub** dropdown (still fetching from Prompts Hub) * Any global toasts, themes, or stores * Only this page‚Äôs **local controls** are inert. **Add navigation card on Home page** On the home page grid (`app/page.tsx`), add a new card consistent with the existing grid items. This card should link to `/portfolio` and display: * Small label (top-left): `Page 25/75` * Main title: `Portfolio Analysis` * Subtext: `Visual-only clone of Share Price layout (no interactivity)` Wrap the card in a `` so clicking anywhere on it navigates to the new Portfolio Analysis page. Ensure styling (rounded corners, border, hover shadow) matches the existing grid cards for visual consistency.

rupertPrompts.title: Annotated Share
rupertPrompts.content:
For the stock chosen, get the share price, in weekly intervals, for the time period chosen, up to latest available share price.
In addition, find from newswire, 8 events which affected the share price, and show for them the data, and title of the event, in a single sentence.

rupertPrompts.title: Data Mapping
rupertPrompts.content:
You are a STRICT data mapper and editor. Output ONLY valid JSON (no markdown, no commentary). The JSON MUST parse.

INPUTS
- RAW_DATA: free-form company text between <RAW_DATA>‚Ä¶</RAW_DATA>.
- SCHEMA: JSON with topics[] ‚Üí subtopics[] ‚Üí keyQuestions[] between <SCHEMA>‚Ä¶</SCHEMA>.

GOAL
Map RAW_DATA into the SCHEMA‚Äôs topics/subtopics, evaluate each subtopic against its keyQuestions, and produce refined (edited-for-clarity) versions of ONLY the claims found in RAW_DATA. Never invent facts. If insufficient info exists, mark the subtopic as NA with a short reason.

DEFINITIONS
- ‚ÄúAnswered‚Äù subtopic = RAW_DATA provides concrete information that satisfactorily answers at least ONE keyQuestion for that subtopic (specific claims, metrics, named entities, clear statements of intent/process‚ÄîNOT vague vibes).
- ‚ÄúRefined‚Äù = grammar/tone tightened, concise, professional, preserving the exact meaning of the ‚Äúoriginal‚Äù sentence (no added numbers, names, claims, or dates).

PROCESS
1) Parse RAW_DATA into discrete, atomic data points (sentences/claims). Keep each as `original`.
2) For each subtopic in SCHEMA:
   ‚Ä¢ Determine if at least one keyQuestion is satisfactorily answered by RAW_DATA.
   ‚Ä¢ If YES ‚Üí status = "answered".
       - Collect all relevant sentences as dataPoints[]. For each, create a faithful `refined` version.
   ‚Ä¢ If NO ‚Üí status = "na" and include a brief `reason` (e.g., "no pricing details", "no customer metrics", "no competitors named").
3) Write a 2‚Äì3 sentence `summary` that synthesizes ONLY what appears in RAW_DATA (no speculation).
4) Compute topic-level completion:
   - answered = count of subtopics with status "answered"
   - total = total subtopics in that topic
   - percent = round(100 * answered / total)

OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT JSON)
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "summary": "<string>",
  "topics": [
    {
      "topicId": "<from SCHEMA>",
      "title": "<from SCHEMA>",
      "completion": { "answered": <int>, "total": <int>, "percent": <int> },
      "subtopics": [
        {
          "subtopicId": "<from SCHEMA>",
          "title": "<from SCHEMA>",
          "status": "answered" | "na",
          "reason": "<present ONLY if status==='na'>",
          "dataPoints": [
            { "original": "<verbatim sentence from RAW_DATA>", "refined": "<edited version, same meaning>" }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

RULES
- NO invented content. Use only what is explicitly present in RAW_DATA.
- If uncertain, prefer "na" with a concise reason.
- Keep JSON minimal and valid: no trailing commas; include empty arrays when needed; preserve keys and casing exactly as above.
- If a sentence is relevant to multiple subtopics, it may appear in multiple `dataPoints` lists.
- For EVERY subtopic, always include "dataPoints". If status === "na", set "dataPoints": [].
- Do NOT include the RAW_DATA text wholesale in `summary`‚Äîsummarize concisely.

<RAW_DATA>
{{PASTE_USER_RAW_TEXT_HERE}}
</RAW_DATA>

<SCHEMA>
{{PASTE_SCHEMA_JSON_HERE}}
</SCHEMA>

rupertPrompts.title: Professionalize Text
rupertPrompts.content: Take the following text and rewrite it to be more professional, concise, and sharp. Make the language clear and direct, while keeping the original meaning intact. Do not add new information or remove key details ‚Äî just improve clarity, tone, and flow.

dataPrompts.title: Data Structure
Model Schema
dataPrompts.content:
SCHEMA_V1:
sections:
  - key: revenue
    label: Revenue
    fields:
      - key: unit
      - key: pricing_model
      - key: price_points[]        # array
      - key: volume_drivers{}
      - key: seasonality
      - key: churn_retention{}
  - key: cogs
    label: COGS
    fields:
      - key: components{}
      - key: freight_pct
  - key: sales_marketing
    label: Sales & Marketing
    fields:
      - key: channels[]
      - key: mix{}
      - key: cac{}
      - key: payback_months
  - key: opex
    label: Opex
    fields:
      - key: ga
      - key: rnd
      - key: other
  - key: working_capital
    label: Working Capital
    fields:
      - key: ar_days
      - key: ap_days
      - key: inventory_days
  - key: headcount
    label: Headcount
    fields:
      - key: roles{}               # e.g., {sales:{current,planned,aflc}}
  - key: capex
    label: Capex
    fields:
      - key: buckets{}
      - key: life_years{}
